Cloud Systems Engineer

Equity
Conduce Inc.

Job Description

Conduce is building a data visualization platform for real-time operational monitoring and collaborative data discovery.  Our IT Operations team provides stable, scalable and secure infrastructure to make this happen.  Using tooling and development best practices, we define systems as code which can be run anywhere, on anything.

We are currently looking for a Systems Engineer to join our IT Operations team to help build, deploy, and maintain our infrastructure.

You’ll work alongside developers and system integrators to deliver our platform and support customer projects, including participating in a (weekly) on-call rotation.  You’ll be 100% focused on all things Cloud, Linux, deployment and automation.

Skills & Requirements

Conduce evaluates candidates on potential, not a list of skills. That said, we’re paying attention if you have experience with:

  • Configuration Management (we use SaltStack)
  • Cloud providers (Google and Azure)
  • Managing a Cassandra deployment
  • Linux (we use Debian)
  • Networking and VPNs
  • Scripting (we use Shell and Python)

An exceptional candidate will also have experience with:

  • Colocation/Private Cloud
  • LXC (We use it for testing)
  • Packaging software for customer deployment
  • HashiCorp tooling (Consul, Vagrant, Vault, Terraform)
  • Log Aggregation/Performance/Service Monitoring (we use Graylog/Prometheus/Sensu)

To apply, please send the following:

A short cover letter letting us know what you think is interesting about the work going on at Conduce and how your background fits with what we're doing.

A resume in PDF format.

About Conduce Inc.

Conduce is a growing enterprise software company with a world-class team and a big vision for helping people, leaders and teams unlock information and unleash their potential. We've also got a sense of humor (despite our website mugshots), and we're located just a short walk from the beach near Santa Barbara, California.  Working remotely (within US only) possible for the right candidate; must be able to travel to California office as needed.

If you recognize the power of data to revolutionize the way the world works - and you've got the skills and ambition to do something about it - we'd like to get to know you.

Salary and stock options commensurate with experience.  Competitive benefits package.

DevOps Engineer

Device Magic

Job Description

Device Magic is hiring our first DevOps engineer. The performance and reliability of our backend infrastructure is a critical tool for our customers, many of whom rely on it to keep their businesses operating. Every day we work to make sure that it runs more reliably and helps them work more easily and accurately. You'll be an integral part of this, and get the reward of knowing that the work you do makes a real difference to so many people's livelihoods.

You will be responsible for managing, monitoring, and scaling both our cloud and on-premise infrastructure. You'll help us design and introduce more automation to support our currently very rapid growth in usage and throughput.

You will also be responsible for ensuring we keep critical failures to a minimum, and responding timeously to them when they do occur.

Day-to-day you will collaborate with our Ruby on Rails engineers and our CTO to hunt down and resolve performance and reliability bottlenecks. We prefer to work in one or two week sprints, with engineers being involved in deciding what gets addressed in each, and responsible for delivering.

Skills & Requirements

  • Computer science / engineering degree or equivalent work experience.
  • Experience with a variety of scripting and automation tools. (We primarily use Chef.)
  • Comfortable with software through the full stack (Rails preferred), including across multiple operating systems.
  • Ability to deploy and maintain both SQL and NoSQL databases.
  • Work effectively within a globally distributed engineering team.

About Device Magic

Device Magic is a profitable, scaling SaaS startup, whose Mobile Forms product helps teams collect information with their phones and tablets. Banks, breweries, engineers, truckers, market researchers, charities and tattoo parlors use us everyday to make their work easier.

Our server-side infrastructure is an AWS-hosted Rails app that allows our customers to build their forms, manage their devices, and direct and access their submission data. Our (native) mobile apps all receive their forms and deliver their submissions through this infrastructure, and we have a rich external API through which many customers manage all of this.

vinSUITE is building a next generation technology stack for our winery DtC software solution and we need your help.  We need a DevOps Engineer to work alongside our core product engineers to make sure they have the information, tools, and reliable systems they need to help our customers sell more wine - because we make software for wine.  And yes, we know that's awesome.

You'll enable greater levels of wine success using Elastic Search, Cloudwatch to organize log data and metrics from thousands of cloud and in store systems.  You'll combine log data with browser crash reporting tools and server resource metrics to assemble a total picture of how our systems are behaving in the field complete with pretty charts and graphs.  You'll help modernize our continuous integration pipeline with Jenkins.  And you'll help keep our AWS services up and running using tools like CloudFormation and Ansible.

You'll work with people who are as nice as they are smart.  You'll get the guidance you need and you won't be shamed when you stumble across a problem you don't know how to solve on your own.  You'll deal with a minimum of corporate nonsense and get the freedom to do things right.  

And you'll do all this from the comfort of your own home.  This is a remote position, but you'll keep in touch with your team with daily virtual standups.  We'll pick a spot on the map every so often and get together for a technical conference or in person design confab.

Required Qualifications

  • A bachelors degree in Computer Scienceor equivalent experience.
  • At least 3 years of experience managing or administrating CentOS and UbuntuLinux servers.
  • At least 2 years of experience with a configuration management tool like Chef, Puppet, or Ansible.  (Ansible preferred.)
  • At least 2 years of experience with Amazon Web Services, including S3, EC2, ELB, VPC, and Cloud Formation.
  • At least 1 year working with a continuous integration platform like Bamboo, TeamCity, Circle CI or Jenkins. (Jenkins Preferred).
  • An almost fanatical security mindset.  You'd introduce SELinuxand IP Tables, even if we weren't already using them.
  • Exposure to Elastic Searchand SQS in a clustered environment.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • A desire to do things right and the ability to take ownership of difficult problems.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Enough experience with Agile development methodologies to see their strengths and weaknesses.
  • Experience with Github or Bitbucketas well as the Atlassian suite of stuff everybody seems to use these days.
  • Payment card industry experience or experience building PCI compliant systems.

  • Experience building and deploying software as RPM's.  (You've created an RPM build spec.)
  • Experience with a log analysis and visualization tool like the ELK Stack.
  • Experience with Datadog.
  • Experience with VMWare.
  • Experience with New Relic or Raygun.

You must have the right to work in the US legally.  Offshore applicants will not be considered, but this isn't for political reasons.  It's for we're-not-big-enough-to-make-offshore-work-effectively reasons.

About Granbury Solutions

We're Granbury Solutions. We make software for malls, pizza shops, coffee shops and yes, wineries. Our vinSUITE system is used by thousands of users all over the world to satisfy the needs of small, medium and large wineries everywhere.

We work from home and we get together every day for a virtual stand up.  We go to at least one conference a year and we sometimes fly in for design sessions or project war rooms.  We try to take cool nerdy field trips.  Last time we went to the Hanford LIGO Observatory and saw how giant lasers can detect gravity waves.  It was cool.

Wikimedia Foundation

About Wikimedia Foundation

About the Wikimedia Foundation

The Wikimedia Foundation is the non-profit organization that supports and hosts Wikipedia and several other Wikimedia free knowledge sites. Every month, the Wikimedia sites are accessed by more than a billion unique devices. Wikipedia consists of more than 40 million articles across hundreds of languages. Every month, more than 70,000 volunteer editors contribute to Wikipedia. Based in San Francisco, California, the Wikimedia Foundation is an audited, 501(c)(3) non-profit that is funded primarily through donations and grants. It currently employs over 240 staff members.

At the Foundation, we build technology to help people everywhere access Wikipedia, across devices and in nearly 300 languages. We engineer privacy for our readers and editors so they can safely and securely explore Wikipedia. We create programs and initiatives to make Wikipedia freely available to more people in more parts of the world. We build new tools for the community of editors so they can continue to improve and grow Wikipedia. Roughly a quarter of our budget goes to supporting the community that make the site possible, including through grantmaking programs that enable volunteers and enrich the information on the sites.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.

You can expect to help us continue growing our engineering and people culture in a way that’s healthy and vibrant.

REQUIREMENTS

Desired Skills & Experience

The requirements and experience below outlines what we need to help us manage and grow our production build infrastructure.   • You have experience with Chef, Puppet, Ansible, or other modern configuration management tooling.
  • You are familiar with Terraform, Packer, or other tools that support the values of infrastructure as code.
  • You have experience with automating one or more cloud platforms through their APIs and SDKs. Familiarity with the vSphere API and SDK is a huge bonus.
  • You have a demonstrated desire and ability to learn.

Tools and Technologies We Use

We have a pretty diverse set of technologies that make up our stack. The list below highlights many of the key ones, and should give you a sense of what tools and technologies you’d be working with day to day.

  • Compute Environments
    • Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2)

    • Go
    • Shell scripting
  • Data Stores
    • PostgreSQL
    • Redis
    • RabbitMQ
  • Automation Tools
    • Chef

    • Packer
  • Productivity Tools/Services
    • GitHub
    • Travis CI (of course ^_^ )
    • Slack
    • Librato
    • Papertrail
    • HelpScout

BENEFITS

Being a distributed team, you can work from wherever you want. You don’t have to go to Berlin, but we’re happy to fly you in for your on-boarding, and for additional visits according to our office visit policy for remote team members.

You choose your working hours. We understand life comes with responsibilities and complications. We have families and personal lives and we encourage all our builders to spend time tending to them.

Minimum paid leave per year is 25 days.

Your health insurance is partially covered by Travis CI. We’ll generally split about 50/50 between employer and employee (up to €250 employer contribution), no matter where you are. US based employees are offered a generous benefits package which includes healthcare, 401k, commuter, and other pre-tax benefits through the co-employment organization we partner with.

items.content:
*IT Ops /Reliability Engineer*
_IT Superhero_

Shoreditch, London
Base & Equity

*Curve is growing - join our adventurous startup!*
We believe that the next generation of banking will be a single mobile platform that enables payment anywhere with any card from any account, and connects people in a simple way with the best technologies and financial offers - putting them back in control of their finances.

Our team of award winning (voted leading startup at the EPAwards ‘16 and included in Tech City’s Upscale ‘17 startup programme) entrepreneurs, product-builders and customer-focused marketers are developing a ground-breaking product with the customer at the core. To start with, we’ve taken the humble bank card and injected it with a whole load of innovation. Technical complexity, scalability, security and real-time transactions are all part of the day-to-day challenges; the future will include machine learning & big data.

With funding from the Who’s Who in angel investors and an experienced and ambitious founding team, we are at the forefront of London FinTech.

If you like to be intellectually stretched, your capabilities tested and want an opportunity to have a real voice, input and impactful contribution, then we’re offering that in abundance.

*_You bring your expertise; we’ll give you the platform to flex your talent!_*

*Role Objective:*
If you’re an IT Ops Superhero, we need you here at Curve! We’re looking for you to help and support the the team and company reach its goals every day. Your mission should you choose to accept it will be to be responsible for providing support, implementing solutions and defining company policies.

*Tasks & Responsibilities include:*
* Maintaining production systems as they scale in capacity and complexity
* Providing internal support, including procedural documentation and relevant reports;
* Monitoring and maintaining our computer systems and networks
* Manage and ensure the compliance of office IT infrastructure and of company policies
* Work with development teams and the management to define an auditable and compliant production system
* Participate in 24/7 on-call rotation policy by responding to system and emergency problems
* NOT doing routine administration BUT engineering an automated solution!

*Our ideal team member will have the following skills & experience*

*Essential:*
* Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills
* Experience in deploying/administering Linux/Mac machines
* Experience with Powershell/Bash/scripting languages
* Experience in IT support and maintenance
* Basic knowledge of databases and the rules of distributed systems

*Bonus points for:*
* Solid CS Degree
* Experience with Java/Python/Ruby/C++/ a modern programming language
* Experience with security and IT policies definition
* Experience with Agile e.g. Scrum/Kanban
* Not being “super focused” on a operating-system or on a programming language!

*Core behaviours:*
* Collaborative & Communicative - Enthusiastic and open team player
* Courage - Not afraid of complexity
* “Can-do” Attitude - Focussed on getting the job done whatever it takes
* Curious & Innovative - Delivering the best solution today, whilst unearthing tomorrow
* Self-Aware and ambitious - Embracing a positive culture of blameless post-mortems, admitting mistakes and continuous improvement

*With your future in mind:*
You will also be part of the SRE team and will contribute to a distributed production system.
This is a unique growth opportunity for someone coming from a pure-support or operational background. If you’re not scared by the complexity of code or by the configuration nuances of an operating system, this is an exceptional opportunity for you to come onboard and shape the future of this system….especially if you’re looking to upskill to a Cloud Engineer.

We’re a small team but growing quickly! And we intend to do so while keeping the emphasis on the “Engineering” part.

*About Us*
We’re a team of circa 30, who work closely together to turn dreams and ideas into actions and product innovation. With a flat hierarchy and an ability to make decisions quickly, we’re based in a great office in Shoreditch, close to Old Street – the heart of the vibrant tech centre of London.

Our user base is growing daily and we have exceptional user retention. We have funding from the leading names in tech investment, and a founder who wants everyone who joins this remarkable adventure to have the autonomy to exercise and develop their expertise.

*Our Recruitment Philosophy & Hiring Principles:*
We’re committed to building a product that people want, and we can’t do it without having a talented team with a meaningful stake in the business. Everyone who joins us and contributes to Curve’s success is rewarded with equity.

The more talent we have the more we can collectively accomplish - so we support and assist each other to reach and surpass what we believe we are capable of.

*How we aim to look after you*
* Monthly health & wellbeing budget for gym, etc.
* If you work late, we make sure you have supper and a taxi home
* Team Lunch Fridays
* Infinite stream of fruit & snacks and great coffee
* Generous holiday allowance

*Start a conversation:*
By sending Anney Wyner, our Talent Lead, as much information as possible about you; *your personal projects, Github/ STO links, any open source contributions, your philosophy & ambitions and why Curve is of interest to you and what you feel you can contribute!*

_The successful applicant will be required to undertake DBS checks in accordance with regulations._
